member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.QualifiedSourceName
member.summary: The source of event notification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Time
member.summary: Time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition.

remarks.para: For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Message
member.summary: Event notification message describing the event.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.EventType
member.summary: Simple, Condition-Related, or Tracking event.

remarks.para: Internal value of one of constants.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.CategoryId
member.summary: Event category ID.

remarks.para: Standard and Vendor-specific event category codes.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Severity
member.summary: Event severity (1..1000).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ConditionName
member.summary: The name of the condition related to this event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.SubconditionName
member.summary: The name of the current sub-condition, for multi-state conditions. For a single-state condition, this contains the condition name.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Enabled
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is enabled.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Active
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is active.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Acknowledged
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is acknowledged.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Quality
member.summary: Quality associated with the condition.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.AcknowledgeRequired
member.summary: This flag indicates that the related condition requires acknowledgment of this event.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The determination of those events which require acknowledgment is server specific. For example, transition into a LimitAlarm condition would likely require an acknowledgment, while the event notification of the resulting acknowledgment would likely not require an acknowledgment.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ActiveTime
member.summary: Time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions).

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Cookie
member.summary: Server defined cookie associated with the event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The cookie is used by the client when acknowledging the condition. This value is opaque to the client.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ActorId
member.summary: Actor ID.

para.b: This property is used only for Tracking Events and for Condition-Related Events which are acknowledgment notifications (see EventType).

remarks.para: For tracking events, this is the actor ID for the event notification.
For condition-related events, this is the AcknowledgerID when the new state is acknowledged. If the AcknowledgerID is an empty string, the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
For other events, the value is an empty string.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload
member.summary: A payload for OPC Alarms&Events notifications.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.DefaultEventSeverity
member.summary: Event severity used when the event arguments contain no event, and the default event payload is not specified.
member.remarks: The OPC-A&E severities are from 0(1) to 1000. The value 9999 is chosen to be higher than the severity of any OPC-A&E event, yet still in a 4-digit range.

member.summary: The display string for the current object.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.BrowseAreas(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified area for child areas. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. A parent area is passed in. No filtering.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Fully qualified name of the parent area to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular area found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the areas.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.BrowseSources(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified area for child sources. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. A parent area is passed in. No filtering.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Fully qualified name of the parent area to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular source found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the sources.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.SubscribeEvents(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Subscribe to OPC events. Specify server descriptor and subscription parameters objects, and "refresh when active" flag.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Subscription parameters to be used when the subscription is created

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the event subscription.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.summary: The display string for the current object.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClientManagement.SharedInstance
member.summary: A default, shared instance of the client object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We do not recommend to use the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or th final application expects.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEQualifiedNameTemplateAttribute.TemplateString
member.summary: The template string.

remarks.para: Null is allowed, because it allows to disable the template use from certain level onwards.

Following macros can be used in template strings:
$(ParentQualifiedName) The OPC qualified name of parent node.
$(BrowseName) The browse name of current node.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ErrorId
member.summary: Map the error ID, as

member.summary: Map the exception, as or a derived type. null if the operation has been successful.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Map the error message, as . An empty string if the operation has been successful.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.StatusInfo
member.summary: Map the status information, as .

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.QualifiedSourceName
member.summary:
Map the source of event notification.
Remarks:
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Time
member.summary:
Map the time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition.
Remarks:
For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Message
member.summary:
Map the event notification message describing the event. This is the default mapping kind.
Remarks:
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.EventType
member.summary:
Map indication of Simple, Condition-Related, or Tracking event.
Remarks:
One of constants.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.CategoryId
member.summary:
Map event category ID.
Remarks:
Standard and Vendor-specific event category codes.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Severity
member.summary:
Map the event severity (1..1000).
Remarks:
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.AttributeValues
member.summary:
Map a dictionary of vendor-specific event attributes.
Remarks:
Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should be set to VT_EMPTY.
This is a dictionary where the key is attribute ID, and the value is the actual value of that event attribute.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Value
member.summary:
Map vendor-specific event attribute, specified by its ID.
Remarks:
Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should be set to VT_EMPTY.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ConditionName
member.summary:
Map the name of the condition related to this event notification.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.SubconditionName
member.summary:
Map the name of the current sub-condition, for multi-state conditions. For a single-state condition, this contains the condition name.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Enabled
member.summary:
Map new state of the condition: The condition is enabled.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Active
member.summary:
Map new state of the condition: The condition is active.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Acknowledged
member.summary:
Map new state of the condition: The condition is acknowledged.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Quality
member.summary:
Map the quality associated with the condition, as .
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.AcknowledgeRequired
member.summary:
Map a flag indicating that the related condition requires acknowledgment of this event.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The determination of those events which require acknowledgment is server specific. For example, transition into a LimitAlarm condition would likely require an acknowledgment, while the event notification of the resulting acknowledgment would likely not require an acknowledgment.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ActiveTime
member.summary:
Map time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions).
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Cookie
member.summary:
Map server defined cookie associated with the event notification.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).
The cookie is used by the client when acknowledging the condition. This value is opaque to the client.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ActorId
member.summary:
Map actor ID.
Remarks:
This property is used only for Tracking Events and for Condition-Related Events which are acknowledgment notifications (see EventType).
For tracking events, this is the actor ID for the event notification.
For condition-related events, this is the AcknowledgerID when the new state is acknowledged. If the AcknowledgerID is an empty string, the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
For other events, the value is an empty string.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Reactive.AENotificationObservable.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new notification observable for OPC events given by the machine name, server class, and other parameters.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
member.returns: Returns an observable for notifications about given OPC events.
member.remarks: The selector will be used for OPC Alarms&Events operations.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.EasyAEClientCore.AcknowledgeCondition(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AENodeDescriptor,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64)
member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses server descriptor for specifying the OPC server. Use default acknowledger ID and an empty comment.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

exception.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
This is a usage error, i.e. it will never occur (the exception will not be thrown) in a correctly written program. Your code should not catch this exception.
The value of an argument is outside the allowable range of values as defined by the invoked method.
This is a usage error, i.e. it will never occur (the exception will not be thrown) in a correctly written program. Your code should not catch this exception.

The OPC "Classic" (or OPC XML-DA) operation has failed. This operation exception in uniformly used to allow common handling of various kinds of errors. The always contains information about the actual error cause.
This is an operation error that depends on factors external to your program, and thus cannot be always avoided. Your code must handle it appropriately.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseBranches(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browse for child branches. Specify machine name, and server class.
member.param: Name of the machine (empty string for local computer).
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to browse.
ID of the parent branch to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular branch found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the branches.
member.exception: An error has occurred during application execution.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseLeaves(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browse for child leaves. Specify machine name, and server class.
member.param: Name of the machine (empty string for local computer).
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to browse.
ID of the parent branch to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular leaf found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the leaves.
member.exception: An error has occurred during application execution.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseServers(System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified computer and returns information about OPC (Data Access) servers found.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer to browse for OPC servers. May be an empty string, in which case the local computer will be browsed.
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular OPC server found on the specified machine. The keys of the keyed collection are the server's CLSIDs.
member.exception: An error has occurred during application execution.

member.summary: Changes parameters of a subscription. Specify handle, and requested update rate.
member.param: Item subscription handle as returned by the SubscribeItem method
The new requested update rate.

remarks.para: It is more efficient to change multiple subscriptions using method.
This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.summary: Gets a value of OPC property, using individual parameters specifying the OPC server, and OPC Item ID.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
The Item ID of the OPC item involved in the operation.
The numerical value of the Property ID of the OPC property being obtained
member.returns: If successful, the function returns the actual value of the OPC property requested.
member.exception: An error has occurred during application execution.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClientManagement.SharedInstance
member.summary: A default, shared instance of the client object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We also do not recommend using the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or the final application expects.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAClientMapper.DefaultClient
member.summary: A default client object.

remarks.para: The default client object is used when no client object is specified in the constructor of the mapper.
When the default client object is used, it is shared among all client mappers.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAClientMapper.SharedInstance
member.summary: A default, shared instance of the mapper object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We also do not recommend using the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or the final application expects.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAMappingContext.ItemIdTemplateString
member.summary: The template string for OPC item IDs.

remarks.para:
Following macros can be used in template strings:
$(ParentNodePath) The OPC node path of the parent node. Only used with OPC XML.
$(ParentItemId) The OPC Item Id of parent node.
$(BrowseName) The browse name of current node.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAMappingProvider.SharedInstance
member.summary: A default, shared instance of the mapping provider object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We also do not recommend using the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or the final application expects.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAMappingProvider.GetTypeMappingDefinition(System.Type)
member.summary: Obtains a type mapping definition for a given type, either by looking up an already loaded definition, or loading it, if not known to the provider yet.
member.param: The type for which the type mapping definition should be obtained.
member.returns: The existing or newly loaded type mapping definition; null if the type is not for mapping.

remarks.para:
supports following meta-members:
GroupParameters: , an object containing subscription parameters, such as the requested update rate.
NodeDescriptor: , the descriptor of the OPC node involved in the operation.
ReadParameters: , the read parameters (such as data source or value age).

overloads.summary: Executes the "Get" operation on members of given target object.
overloads.remarks: The "Get" operation obtains value of an OPC property and stores it into the mapping source. Only mappings of type are affected; other mappings are ignored.

member.param: The client mapper object that will perform the operation.
The object being targeted.
The operation will be performed only on mappings tagged with this mapping tag.
true to operate on sub-targets (mapped members of the target) recursively; false otherwise.

exception.para: One of the arguments provided to a method is not valid.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.Resource1.DAClientMapper_ItemMissingGroupParameters
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The data access item mapping cannot participate in Subscribe operation, because it contains no group parameters. If you are using attribute-based mapping, you might be missing DASubscriptionAttribute. If you do not want the mapping participate in Subscribe operation, you can exclude it using the Operations member of the mapping (or Operations argument of DAItemAttribute). This error should not happen unless you explicitly specify the values in mapping context, because the default mapping context contains de [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.Resource1.DAClientMapper_ItemMissingNodeDescriptor
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The member cannot be mapped as OPC data access item, because no node descriptor has been specified in the mapping context. You might be missing the DANodeAttribute..

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.Resource1.DAClientMapper_ItemMissingReadParameters
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The data access item mapping cannot participate in Read operation, because it contains no read parameters. If you are using attribute-based mapping, you might be missing DAReadAttribute. If you do not want the mapping participate in Read operation, you can exclude it using the Operations member of the mapping (or Operations argument of DAItemAttribute). This error should not happen unless you explicitly specify the values in mapping context, because the default mapping context contains default read paramete [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The member cannot be mapped as OPC data access item, because no server descriptor has been specified in the mapping context. You might be missing the ServerAttribute, or forgot to specify the server descriptor in the mapping context template in the mapper..

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAItemIdTemplateAttribute.ItemIdTemplateString
member.summary: The template string for item Id.

remarks.para: Null is allowed, because it allows to disable the template use from certain level onwards.

Following macros can be used in template strings:
$(ParentNodePath) The OPC node path of the parent node. Only used with OPC XML.
$(ParentItemId) The OPC Item Id of parent node.
$(BrowseName) The browse name of current node.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.LiveMapping.DAItemIdTemplateAttribute.NodePathTemplateString
member.summary: The template string for node path. Only used with OPC XML.

remarks.para: Null is allowed, because it allows to disable the template use from certain level onwards.

Following macros can be used in template strings:
$(ParentNodePath) The OPC node path of the parent node. Only used with OPC XML.
$(ParentItemId) The OPC Item Id of parent node.
$(BrowseName) The browse name of current node.

member.summary: Determines whether the node will be mapped in a deferred manner.

remarks.para: Not to be confused with the , or the access path (only in OPC-DA 1.0, and quite rare).

member.summary: Determines the age of value you would like to obtain (in milliseconds).

remarks.para: This value is significant only when the property is set to ByValueAge.
The value must be greater than or equal to zero, or it must be equal to .
When the value is , the value will always be provided from the memory, i.e. without actually accessing the OPC server.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Reactive.DAItemChangedObservable`1
member.summary: Push-based notification provider (observable) for changes in OPC Data Access item(s).
member.typeparam: The type of OPC values provided.
member.remarks: The notifications will contain for each OPC item change. All OPC items in one must be assignable to the type. Typically, you will create the observable for items of the same type. You can also choose a common denominator type; for example, if you use for , you can use it in a type-less manner).

overloads.summary: Create a new instance of the item change observable.

member.summary: The currently active sub-condition, for multi-state conditions which are active. For a single-state condition, this contains the information about the condition itself. For inactive conditions, this value is null.

member.summary: The quality associated with the condition state.

member.summary: The time of the most recent acknowledgment of this condition (of any sub-condition).

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.SubCondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into active sub-condition. This is the time value which must be specified when acknowledging the condition. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.CondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into the condition. There may be transitions among the sub-conditions which are more recent. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.CondLastInactive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition out of this condition. This value is DateTime.MinValue if the condition has never been active, or if it is currently active for the first time and has never been exited.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.AcknowledgerID
member.summary: This is the ID of the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:Opc.Ae.Condition.Comment
member.summary: The comment string passed in by the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: M:Opc.Da.PropertyID.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.remarks: MP: During deserialization, SerializationInfo is passed to the class using the constructor provided for this purpose. Any visibility constraints placed on the constructor are ignored when the object is deserialized; so you can mark the class as public, protected, internal, or private. However, it is best practice to make the constructor protected unless the class is sealed, in which case the constructor should be marked private. The constructor should also perform thorough input validation. To avoid misuse by malicious code, the constructor should enforce the same security checks and permissions required to obtain an instance of the class using any other constructor.
